results.title: Percussion group
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: More than a dozen of the more commonly used percussion instruments are demonstrated. Chief attention is given to the structure, manner of tuning and playing of the tympani. Other percussion instruments represented are the tom-tom, snare drum, bass drum, tambourine, gong cymbals, castanets, triangle bells, celeste, chimes and the xylophone. Included into the compositions used are portions of Schubert’s “March Militaire” and of Tchaikovsky’s “Fourth Symphony”. Demonstrations throughout are given in full orchestral setting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films

results.title: People, productivity and change
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, James Carr, Basic Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: An examination of the problems of change as seen by men and women on the shopfloor and their trade union representatives. When a company decides to make changes in its products, processes or procedures, the trade unions are inevitably involved; the pay, the status, even the jobs of their members may be at stake.

results.title: People who really count
results.brief_description: A staff training film for use by any company which has recently installed a computer. Considers the way in which a computer work, and by illustration, traces the journey of an order from the initial phone call to the final invoice. Points out the need of accuracy in presenting data.

results.title: People of the reindeer = The Wind from the west
results.brief_description: Portrays he lives and superstitions of the Lapps. In the spring the reindeer herds go north, tended by all family except elders and school children. Young Nils however, wooed by the voice of the West Wind, escapes the schoolroom in a day dream and experiences the adventures of which all Lapp boys dream. This film is a re-edit of an earlier film “Wind from the West” [012005].

results.title: People of the Netherlands
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Reviews the history and growth of he Dutch poples; shows their efforts against the sea to secure land enough to support their dense population; and discusses factors influencing the position of the Netherlands among other nations in industry and trade.

results.title: The People mover
results.brief_description: A promotional film on a new type of twin hull ferry designed and built by a Hobart firm. It was built initially to transport people across the Derwent but is also available for overseas sales.

results.title: The Penguins of Macquarie Island
results.brief_description: Observes the habits of the various species of penguins which live on Macquarie Island. The film was compiled from record material photographed by members of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition and officers of the CSIRO. The penguins are seen marching to and from their rookeries, assembling on the beach, looking after their young, and at play. Various features, which distinguish one species from another, are illustrated.

results.title: The Penetrating eye
results.creator_credit: Eli Lilly and Company and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the functioning of a scanning electron microscope and shows how an electron beam, instead of light waves, is used to produce revealing images of microscopically sized specimens. Scanning electron microscope photographs of biological specimens are show and interpreted as to the new information and technique.

results.title: Pencils
results.brief_description: Scenes showing children and adults writing, drawing, and doodling with every imaginable kind of pencil are intercut with sequences filmed at a factory where pencils are manufactured. The variety of pencils, sizes, shapes, colours and uses are conveyed without narration but with a lively musical score.
